text: I reproduced in fabric-sdk-node test instruction.
e.g. "node test/unit/end-to-end.js step1”  inside fabric-sdk-node.  I think SDK is pushing invalid data, but it is not good to fail with panic.
And there is config file.
<@U11CP8FF1|ibmamnt> uploaded a file: <https://hyperledgerproject.slack.com/files/ibmamnt/F3RMK3SQ1/cop-no-tls.json|cop-no-tls.json>
BTW, I have like this:
```$ bin/cop server start -config testdata/cop-no-tls.json -loglevel 0 > cop.log 2>&1 ```
<@U13TWBRBL>: <@U0S5KF44D> exactly, i do a same workaround in Python SDK, I'd like cop support env variable ASAP

@ibmant Regarding the panic, it should be fixed in <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/3877/> which is not yet merged, right <@U1KJY9BJQ>?  If you want, you could pull into your env and verify before it is merged.
<@U0S5KF44D> <https://jira.hyperledger.org/browse/FAB-1691> is opened for the OCSP error msg
apparently the automatic builds are broken and fail systematically
<@U0P2GSA8Z> Yes, the X builds are good but P and Z are failing.  <@U11HH3P7Y> Any ETA on when these will be fixed?
<@U0S5KF44D> I could see cop is working on few z CI nodes.. <@U0YK3KKCY> working on this..
PLEASE NOTE:

Hi everyone, I know this a bit late, but there have been numerous concerns voiced about the name "COP", reasons including:
* lack of clarity on what it really is
* negative connotation in some cultures
So we are looking to rename the repo, images, and executable to "fabric-ca" ...
oh, and also this slack channel :slightly_smiling_face:
The current COP is afterall a CA (Certificate Authority).
Comments are welcome.
<@U0S5KF44D> `fabric-ca` makes a lot more sense to me. Easy to say with hind-sight, but I think it should always have been called this.
that's what you get for letting <@U0PB67X4K> pick the name :wink:
I was wondering how long we could go on with such a funky name as cop LOL
fabric-ca is boring in comparison but is probably a better choice
I'm fine with it although I don't look forward to the change
it's an easy change to make
:wink:
I'm not exactly sure how to stage the change.   I suppose as follows?
1) Push a non-working change set which changes all the imports, etc to fabric-ca
2) A maintainer with privs changes the name of the repo and merges the change set?
No way to test #1 that I know of before pushing
git aliasing?

we can test #1 locally first of course by just renaming the folder on the file system

I believe that the CI job actually runs `make unit-tests` ?  So we could also add a rule to the target which would rename the folder as well?
Yes, I think that changing the logic “underneath” the CI calls will probably be the simplest.
So can test “everything” (we can) locally
A few of us, pick up/fetch/clone/pull that CR branch and try it locally...
Make changes to “build script”/Makefile
And at the next step, update that script to do the same “end-to-end’ using the new stuff.

Two things that can help:
1. We can start changing the local stuff (e.g., cop.db) regardless of the repo change.
2. We can declare a “code/merge” freeze, from the moment we start “step 2” onwards.
(the last step should not take too long, for the maintainers)
<@U0S5KF44D> <@U11MANG9G> <@U0PB67X4K> suggest we ask <@U0UHG4VP1> how best to deal with this
in the <#C0YMWRX19|ci-pipeline> channel
(since he is not here)
<@U0S5KF44D> so, I know how to reproduce the Internal Server Error I had a couple of days ago
all it takes is to do a second enrollCLI/Main
after TextEnrollCLI
and boom!

2017/01/17 19:15:33 [DEBUG] Getting user admin from the database
2017/01/17 19:15:33 [DEBUG] DB: Login user admin with max enrollments of 1 and state of 1
2017/01/17 19:15:33 [DEBUG] Received response
statusCode=500 (500 Internal Server Error)
--- FAIL: TestEnrollCLI2 (0.01s)
        client_test.go:80: Failed to register, err:  Error response from server was 'The maximum number of enrollments is 1' for request:
                POST <https://localhost:8888/api/v1/cfssl/enroll>
                Authorization: Basic YWRtaW46YWRtaW5wdw==
I absolutely don't know what's going on here but I would think an "Internal Server Error" is not what we want
ever
<@U0P2GSA8Z> yes, we're aware of this.  Let me find the jira item.
ah ok
it's ok, if it's a known problem, that's fine
<https://jira.hyperledger.org/browse/FAB-1676>
ok, thanks
